meanings.definition: The production of offspring that are different from the parents.
meanings.sent1: The xenogeny of the puppies surprised the owners with their unique colors.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study xenogeny to understand how traits can vary in a new generation.
meanings.sent3: The xenogeny of the flowers in the garden made the bees do a double take.
meanings.sent4: Her art displayed a xenogeny of styles, blending traditional and modern techniques.
meanings.sent5: The xenogeny of the music genre created a fresh sound that captivated listeners.

meanings.definition: The introduction of foreign elements into a group or population.
meanings.sent1: The xenogeny of spices in the dish gave it a unique and exotic flavor.
meanings.sent2: Globalization often leads to xenogeny of cultures, bringing diverse traditions together.
meanings.sent3: The xenogeny of new students in the class added excitement to the school year.
meanings.sent4: The xenogeny of ideas sparked a creative revolution in the company.
meanings.sent5: The xenogeny of languages in the region created a rich tapestry of communication.
